comments.commentBody:
Returning authority to the states? How delusional is Walker?

Is each state going to have its own NOAA and its own weather satellites?

Is each state going to have its own EPA? Will one state have to sue its neighbors because their pollution flows across state borders?

Article I of the US Constitution says in part:
No Tax or Duty shall be laid on Articles exported from any State.
No Preference shall be given by any Regulation of Commerce or Revenue to the Ports of one State over those of another; nor shall Vessels bound to, or from, one State, be obliged to enter, clear, or pay Duties in another.

So states have no power to regulate commerce in another state.

If each state is supposed to stand on its own, why do excess Federal tax revenues collected from rich BLUE states get redistributed to poor RED states? You conservatives want to "do your thing" at the state level? Do that on your own nickel, not on my dime.

I can't wait to hear the screaming from the poor RED states when they have to put on their "big boy pants" and "get out of mommy and daddy's house and pay their own way."

Let's kill FEMA. Storm damage or tornado damage? Tough. No more disaster aid from the Federal government. Pay for your own repairs, or buy insurance.

Let all the RED states emulate Kansas. Save all that tax money.

Give Walker what he wants, and watch the discontent grow. There is no other way to get some of these "I know better than you" conservative types to face reality.

It is nice to see the NYT's generosity in letting Mr Walker use it as his bully pulpit. It shows fairness on the part of the Times.

Mr Walker toes the party line when lumping all protests being done by liberals or paid protestors. It's being done by citizens tired of being lied to and taken for granted by politicians like Mr Walker. If someone paid the millions of women who marched on Washington and other places in the world they would have to be mighty wealthy like the Koch brothers.

I wish the GOP would recognize that it is their agenda that is causing protests not people getting paid to voice their outrage at Congress and this Administration. It is highly likely that Democrats, Republicans and Independents are in those crowds. Labels can be mean spirited and deceiving Mr Walker.

Governor Walker, are you putting your money where your mouth is by adamantly opposing any federal overall budget that does not reduce spending? This also includes defense spending. Your fellow "conservatives" in Washington DC are proposing increases in Defense spending, and until the overall amount of money that the federal government spends is reduced, I do not see how any money can be returned to the states.  Without the money, your states-rights argument falls pretty flat.

When Tea Partiers protest, it's democracy at work. Open arms to the Tea Party. Real Americans.

When it's the opposite nasty "liberals" protest, fight back, even if that means passing unconstitutional laws against free speech. Nasty "liberals." Not real Americans.

Republicans must have gotten the idea that someone is funding this new activism because the Koch brothers funded the Tea Party. No one is funding this latest activism, but at least we know where the idea came from.

The irony and hypocrisy is speaking louder than their words. I wonder how many will hear it that way.

Yes, they want all government out of their lives, except that government should tell women what they can do with their bodies, and LGBTs whom they can marry and which bathrooms they can use, and everyone whom, how and whether to worship. Oh, and they want a strong military and a jackbooted border patrol and a police state, but they don't want to pay taxes for those things. They move their billions to the caymans and other tax havens to ensure that the same little people, whose bodies and choices they believe the government should have the power to regulate, pay for the services they demand the government provide.

Oh, God this was painful to read. How did the people of Wisconsin ever decide to elect this awful man?

First, what Mr. Walker describes as "taking on public-sector unions that had too much control over government" can also be seen as deliberately weakening your political opposition. Did Mr. Walker also "take on corporations that have too much control over government"? Don't be silly.

Mr. Walker's self-viewed heroism is nothing more than eroding working conditions, collective bargaining rights, and decimating pensions. And while more people may be working in Wisconsin than ever, at what sort of jobs, and under what conditions?

Why is it that when the Koch-brothers-funded Tea Party protested, Mr. Walker never described it as intimidation, as he does here? Oh, wait - this is the Scott Walker that in a phone conversation fawned all over a man he thought was one of the Koch brothers, but who was really a radio journalist.

As for "returning authority to the states" being the best solution to our country's problems, that argument was already fought, and Mr. Walker's side lost. That was the federalists vs. the anti-federalists.

But this is the sort of thing at which Republican politicians excel: attempted rewrites of history that impress their low-information, fake-news-consuming, followers. Why have a Constitution when you can go back to the Articles of Confederation.

The Constitution protects us from men like Scott Walker. Thank God we have it.

Check out Wisconsin's data under Gov. Walker.  How are we doing in job creation--36th out of 50 (U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics); 1 in 5 children live in poverty/ 18.5% (UW Madison); educational achievement gap for black and white students--worst in the nation (U.S. Dept. of Education).  This is just a sample.  So the nation should follow this lead?  Of course, if we throw data out the window and welcome uninformed bias instead....

It hasn't ended up with teachers, police, and firefighters getting overpaid though, has it? It's not as if they get free health care for life, just for signing up, like the way all our representatives in congress do.

Perhaps more people are employed in Wisconsin thanks to your "leadership" but how many are making a living wage?  I can only imagine that the wealthy love you because you increase their profits while making the workforce desperate and compliant.  This distopian future, where the poor get poorer and the richer revel in their destruction is not one that I find compelling.  Neither is one where businesses face a patchwork of 50 different health care requirements for their employees.  None of this makes sense unless you're just a wealthy local businessman who has neither the interest or capacity to operate outside his or her local state.  I suppose these are the people who support you.  As such they don't have a lot of votes, but they do have a lot of money.  A very sad commentary on democracy in action.  If you win, the majority of Americans lose.

States rights for sure: all powers not delegated to the Federal government. So when a state faces a natural or manmade disaster don't come with your sob story to Washington looking for relief. Live by the sword and die thereby.

What a wimp! So afraid of so called liberals and the monsters from the left?
Republicans are spineless, greedy, glitter suckers who are basically fending for themselves. I pity the poor and defenseless voter who wants to attain that status for themselves.
It's an empty way of life.
Protest for your rights! Protect women, men and children from people like this man!

you are right--but look at the example set by Governor Walker.  He stokes fear and hatred for liberalism without even attempting to understand what its goals are.   I am afraid that that two sides have such opposing philosophies that it will be impossible to get anywhere.

Teachers need to pay deductibles and co-pays the same as their constituents.I hate to break it to you but teachers are pushing people out of their homes with unrealistic property taxes.In my town teachers are the 1%

Being a teacher with all that education,you still haven't learned that the public's wages have stagnated for 30 years?

Mr Walker if you are so anti big government then please relinquish your elite government pension and health care plan. Get your own HSA and fund your own 401K, like you propose the citizens do. Big business destroyed the unions in the 1980s when it embarked on predatory capitalism. Taxes for the corporations plummeted, and they have withdrawn health plans and pensions for the workers and instead filled the coffers of the CEOs and shareholders. Get out of the pockets of big business and start representing and having the back of ordinary middle class ( if it even exists anymore) and lower income citizens. Your hypocrisy is killing the American Dream.

Scott Walker is the living embodiment of Republican governors who cut taxes and pauperize their states with grandiose assertions that they are "freeing"  the people from union dues, health insurance costs, better schools and all those tiresome regulations that prevent pollution of our air and water. The GOP's pending repeal of the ACA would replace health care with "access to health care" -- should you be able to afford it. If not, please die.
He clearly has not been hearing what the protestors were saying, nor adding up the cost of Trumps promises. When the author argues with open eyes, he might find more open minds.

I am one who would vilify Scott Walker and many other Republicans. I think they are awful. But I just spent ten minutes looking through these comments and all I saw was reasoned argumentation. Certainly rhetoric often gets out of hand but I'm not seeing it here. I think it's often the case that people view criticism and disagreement and a personal attack when not such attack is implied.

That is the reason that the left is no longer in power in the House, Senate and White House. We were tired of the left being more interested in pet social engineering projects and illegal immigrants than American citizens. The results of elections for the past few years shows what average citizens feel about the liberal view of this country.

If this doesn't give life perspective, what does?

I have tried for decades to convince my husband life does not go on forever and that some things are just not important. But some are, mostly like being grateful instead of being anxious.

The writer is obviously grateful for the man in her life, in good times and not so good times, sickness and in health, and all the rest of those vow things we take for granted in our beginnings.

As we get older we do in our mind sort out things dear to us - who would like this, who would appreciate that. But to think about that in human terms, who would like the person most dear to us is so completely unselfish and evidence of generoous love. It is one thing to envision a piece of jewelry on a recipient, or a favorite piece of art hanging in someone elses foyer as a momento, you know, stuff, but to envision our life companion with someone else might be very difficult.

But Amy, your endearing piece here is such a tribute, not only to your husband, but to your determination of life: maybe it is better to give than to receive. Perhaps that is really the best way to seek, to like, to love, and to live.

The best to you both and to the kids, too. You have it figured out, more than most of us will ever be able to come to terms with. Thank you.

Actually, your husband sounds like a very lucky man. He's known love.
Fly well Amy!

Nice try Gov-the union busting thing was to give employers (including the state) less payrol liability plain and simple-how else to achieve more profits? . Unions did not have control over government-what a lame thing to say for the man who leads the state government! Goodness do you really think you can get away with ascribing union efforts to give their members a living wage and reasonable working conditions to some vague desire to 'control' government?

And you just might want to check that claim that it is liberals that are protesting-how about average Americans that see their Federal Government about to cut taxes for the wealthy, eviscerate environental and workers' rights regulations so corporations can make more profits AND take away affordable health care because everyman should fend for himself....take away health care and in stead spend tax dollars on a pointless wall AND 10% more for the military? Seriously?

Republicans have cleary showed their work is to further enrich a wealthy class at the expense of all else. We see your oligarchy and resist your efforts to solidify and grow it!

Wow, Richard, I think this the first comment of yours I've ever recommended. It's good to know that there are some things that we can see eye to eye on.

Healthcare should definitely not be a piecemeal effort, and yes, keep Roe V Wade the law of the land.

Governor Walker: "In response, 100,000 protesters descended on the Capitol, while others protested at the executive residence and even my house." Gee, why would that have been the case? You think, maybe they were angry? The idea that the Federal government is the enemy is, simply, foolish. You write about your successes. I see them as failures.

It takes enormous hubris to ignore the will of 100,000 people in one state. Did it not ever occur to you that they were angry for a reason? Did it not occur to you to question your convictions which so many dislike? You are so sure you know what's right. Well, maybe not.

You, as an educated, white, male, wealthy person would never conclude that you had something to learn from your own citizens. Too bad. It might make you a better governor. And a better person. Cutting taxes is always the answer, except that it's not. Supply side economics has never worked. Guess you missed that. OK, so you have a balanced budget, but how many hungry children do you also have? How many lousy schools?

I consider it a gift to be "liberal". I care about people (whomsoever they may be), the environment (all of it), the poor, elderly, infirm, un-employed and the children. I believe the government of the richest country in the world can easily afford to spend more on its land and people and less on the military. Spend more on schools and teachers. And, yes, unlike Mr. Trump, I am happy to pay taxes if they are used to alleviate those problems.
So, since when did the GOP start hating America!? Protests/Free Sppech are as American as progressive taxation, baseball and apple pie.

Scott Walker still trying to toot his own horn. Our Wisconsin governor who has no college degree who appointed the head of our Natural Resources a woman, Cathy Stepp, who has no college degree. To heck with our resources, a prime source of Wisconsin pride. The department is a fiasco and in the news constantly.

Walker likes to imply Wisconsinites threatened he and his wife. Death threats, so dramatic. And he lived through it, he says. There were protests by hundreds of thousands, true. Death threats? Ummm.....

Truth is Walker never said one thing about getting rid of public employees' rights being taken away from them when he ran in 2010. People didn't know about his conversation with millionaires when he said he was going to "divide and conquer". People didn't know he was going to decimate public school funding and knock our UW system to its knees with $$$ cuts.

People didn't know he would come in and be paid off to have a mine in northern Wisconsin that would poison our waters and put a Native American tribe in danger. They finally backed out.

People didn't know he was basically paying business people millions of dollars under the table with a "new agency" he made up to "save Wisconsin" which has been another fiasco.

People didn't know he would allow the care at our veterans hospital and children's juvenile centers to blow to the wind and now both be under federal investigation.

Yes, Scott Walker is a real gem. Wish Trump would take him to DC and keep him.
